str2: Finally, from now on, henceforth, beyond that. Neuter singular of the same as loipoy; something remaining.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A crown, garland, honor, glory. From an apparently primary stepho; a chaplet, literally or figuratively.
From dikaios; equity; specially justification.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have been put away, be stored, be reserved for. From apo and keimai; to be reserved; figuratively, to await.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.
A judge, magistrate, ruler. From krino; a judge.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and didomi; to give away, i.e. Up, over, back, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Alone, but, only. Neuter of monos as adverb; merely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Appearing, manifestation, glorious display. From epiphanes; a manifestation, i.e. the advent of Christ.
